metadata.title: CVE-2022-2200 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
If an object prototype was corrupted by an attacker, they would have beenable to set undesired attributes on a JavaScript object, leading toprivileged code execution. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 102,Firefox ESR < 91.11, Thunderbird < 102, and Thunderbird < 91.11.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2200` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
